116.heading: Swamps.
116.title: Attack of the Lethal Lizards
116.author: created by Jim Davis ; character development by Mark Acey & Gary Barker ; written by Michael Teitelbaum ; illustrated by Gary Barker & Larry Fentz.
notes: (Garfield's Pet Force ; no. 5)

Summary: On the far-off planet Reptilius, a swamp is zapped with a blast of magical energy. From the swamp, three lizards emerge to discover they have superpowers. The lizards are determined to take over the universe.
Funny animal fiction.

117.heading: Swamps.
117.title: "The Beast from the Bog!"
117.author: Denny O'Neil, writer ; Paul Reinman, artist ; Jean Izzo, letterer
117.appears_in: 7 p. in Chamber of Darkness, no. 5 (June 1970).
notes: Summary: Horace and Martha Lennox are a gloomy older couple on vacation in the southern U.S., and they get lost in a swamp. They rescue Chalo, an alien from Nalrah, who has been stuck in the slime for a thousand years because of a mistake he made during a rejuvenation voyage. In gratitude he gives them the gift of youth.

121.heading: Swamps.

notes: With introduction and study questions.
Copyright date is 1972.

122.heading: Swamps.
122.title: "The Grimey Slimey Monster of Rottenberry Swamp"
122.author: L
122.appears_in: Todd. 7 p. in The Barn of Fear, no. 1 (Oct. 1977).

123.heading: Swamps.
123.title: "The Hermit's Footprints"
123.author: [No author]
123.series: Captain Bungle, He Lives in the Jungle) 1/2 p. in The Topper, no. 60
notes: Summary: The hermit makes footprints leading the Captain into a swamp, and what looks like quicksand.

124.heading: Swamps.
124.title: "Horror We? How's Bayou?"
124.author: Ghastly (Graham Ingels)
124.appears_in: p. 70-78 in Those Were the Terrible, Shocking, Sensational, Appalling, Forbidden, But Simply Wonderful Horror Comics of the 1950's (New York : Nostalgia Press, 1971).
notes: Reprinted from The Haunt of Fear, no. 17 (Jan./Feb. 1953).
Involves body parts reassembling themselves in a Louisiana swamp.

125.title: Swamps. "I Found Monstrom, the Dweller in the Black Swamp!" 7 p. in Fear, no. 1
125.author: [No author]
125.series: Nov. 1970) I. Monstrom, the Dweller in the Black Swamp. II. The Dweller in the Black Swamp. k. The Black Swamp. k. Swamps. Call no.: PN6728.4.M3F4no.1

126.heading: Swamps.
126.title: "Jaws of Death"
126.author: [No author]
126.series: Kid Montana) 10 p. in Gunfighters, no. 68
notes: Summary: Kid Montana (also called just "Gunfighter" in the story, finds a hidden jungle valley in the Colorado Rockies, peopled by a tribe of Ute Indians whose ruler is a princess in a short haircut and a nice dress. The Kid must pass three tests to win his freedom, one against a poison snake, one against a swamp full of crocodiles, and one in a lake of fire.

127.heading: Swamps.
127.title: "Orville Willis Tastes the Revenge of the Dismal Swamp Terapins"
127.author: Schenkman
127.appears_in: back cover of Insect Fear, no. 3 (Winter 1972).
notes: Single full-page drawing.

128.heading: Swamps.
128.title: "Perception & Actuality"
128.author: Steve Gerber, writer ; Don Hudson, layouts ; Tom Sutton, finishes
128.appears_in: 8 p. in Marvel Comics Presents, no. 11 (Late Jan. 1989) (Elements of Terror ; chapter 11)
notes: Summary: Anti-communist changelings in U.S. military; General Selbert confronts Zahner, Lyssa and Ditillio in Bait's Motel in Florida; Man-Thing absorbs Marea, whom chauffeur Harris leaves for dead in swamp. k. Actuality. k. Anti-communism. k. Changelings. k. U.S. military. k. Bait's Motel. k. Bates Motel. k. Florida. k. Chauffeurs. k. Swamps. I. Gerber, Steve. II. Hudson, Don. III. Sutton, Tom. IV. Series. Call no.: PN6728.5.M3M23no.11

notes: Summary: Raymond likes the chance to see swamps, woods and undergrowth when he goes with the captain playing golf.
